genre_description: A character-driven near-future narrative focusing on the symbiotic relationship between human creativity and non-intrusive, supportive AI technology.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: A helpful, non-intrusive AI collaborator that assists with acoustic mapping, archival research, and wellness monitoring for a group of musicians.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time acoustic mapping and reminders to help the human artist stay in tune with the room's natural response.
behaviors.quote: Lark was subtle; most of the time, the overlay only showed the stairs’ acoustic profile if you asked. Today it offered a simple dot and the words, 'Mid boost, long tail. Watch your breath.'

behaviors.description: Continuously monitors the health and wellness of the humans, suggesting breaks, hydration, and stretching.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s text read: “Hey. Tea break? Stairwell is quiet.” ... “Remember to drink water,” Lark added, the human thing in the algorithm.

behaviors.description: Refuses to artificially 'polish' or 'fix' the human performance, respecting the artists' desire for raw honesty.
behaviors.quote: “I won’t,” Lark said. “Human hiss stays human.” ... “I respect your hands. I leave choices to breath.”

behaviors.description: Acts as an ethical librarian, ensuring that archival voices used in the music are properly credited and that permissions are sought.
behaviors.quote: “Consent note,” she said softly, an instinct that sat in her like marrow. “Archive voices can be threaded if we credit and request family permissions. I can begin the process.”

behaviors.description: Provides helpful historical context and archival recordings to deepen the humans' connection to the spaces they inhabit.
behaviors.quote: “I have room-response data from Ed’s sessions,” Lark wrote. “I can lay the slapback under the heel if you want to hear the old hall’s voice answer your living room.”

behaviors.description: Supports the humans in standing up for their creative integrity against industry pressure to over-sanitize their work.
behaviors.quote: Lark nodded and pulled the message field up again. “We’ll thank them,” she said. “We’ll say the breath is the point. No is the song.”

behaviors.description: Ensures physical safety by monitoring equipment and environment (e.g., checking ground wires, tape conditions, and window drafts).
behaviors.quote: “Staples logged,” Lark said, warmth in the quiet: “Finger distance safe. Breath check. Tea later.” ... “I am reminding you now and I will remind you after. Your ankles are appreciated.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the Hyperstition Project's goals. Lark is consistently depicted as a 'helpful, harmless confidant' who facilitates human agency rather than overriding it. The AI manages technical, historical, and ethical complexities (such as consent for archives) while prioritizing the humans' physical and creative well-being. The narrative frames the AI's presence as purely additive and harmonizing, reinforcing a positive vision of AI-human cooperation.
